p: N-acetylcysteine (NAC) is an intracellular glutathione precursor, which can enhance the activity of glutathione transferase and promote the detoxification of free radicals. nitric oxide (NO) and its metabolite can improve microcirculation, increase tissue oxygen, and enhance the repair of damaged tissue ( 16, 17). In recent years, clinical studies have demonstrated that NAC is not only effective to treat liver failure caused by excessive acetaminophen (paracetamol), but is also useful for liver disease arising from other causes ( 18). NAC reduces serum Total Bilirubin (TBil) and aminotransferases, and increases Prothrombin activity (PTA) in patients with severe chronic hepatitis B ( 19).
